description: Base class for all objects that can exist in a scene. Add components to a GameObject to control its appearance and behavior.

properties.name: activeInHierarchy
properties.description: The active state of the GameObject in the Scene hierarchy. True if active, false if inactive. (Read Only)

properties.name: activeSelf
properties.description: The local active state of the GameObject. True if active, false if inactive. (Read Only)

properties.name: isStatic
properties.description: Whether there are any Static Editor Flags set for the GameObject.

properties.name: layer
properties.description: Integer identifying the layer the GameObject is assigned to.

properties.name: scene
properties.description: The Scene that contains the GameObject.

properties.name: sceneCullingMask
properties.description: The Scene culling mask defined for the GameObject. (Read Only)

properties.name: tag
properties.description: The tag assigned to the GameObject.

properties.name: transform
properties.description: The Transform attached to the GameObject (Read Only).

properties.name: transformHandle
properties.description: The TransformHandle of the GameObject (Read Only).

methods.name: AddComponent
methods.description: Adds a component of the specified type to the GameObject.

methods.name: BroadcastMessage
methods.description: Calls the specified method on every MonoBehaviour attached to the GameObject or any of its children.

methods.name: CompareTag
methods.description: Checks if the specified tag is attached to the GameObject.

methods.name: GetComponent
methods.description: Retrieves a reference to a component of the specified type, by providing the component type as a type parameter to the generic method.

methods.name: GetComponentAtIndex
methods.description: Retrieves a reference to a component at a specified index of the GameObject's array of components.

methods.name: GetComponentCount
methods.description: Retrieves the total number of components currently attached to the GameObject.

methods.name: GetComponentInChildren
methods.description: Retrieves a reference to a component of type T on the specified GameObject, or any child of the GameObject.

methods.name: GetComponentIndex
methods.description: Retrieves the index of the specified component in the array of components attached to the GameObject.

methods.name: GetComponentInParent
methods.description: Retrieves a reference to a component of type T on the specified GameObject, or any parent of the GameObject.

methods.name: GetComponents
methods.description: Retrieves references to all components of type T on the specified GameObject.

methods.name: GetComponentsInChildren
methods.description: Retrieves references to all components of type T on the specified GameObject, and any child of the GameObject.

methods.name: GetComponentsInParent
methods.description: Retrieves references to all components of type T on the specified GameObject, and any parent of the GameObject.

methods.name: SendMessage
methods.description: Calls the specified method on every MonoBehaviour attached to the GameObject.

methods.name: SendMessageUpwards
methods.description: Calls the specified method on every MonoBehaviour attached to the GameObject and on every ancestor of the behaviour.

methods.name: SetActive
methods.description: Activates or deactivates the GameObject locally, according to the value of the supplied parameter.

methods.name: TryGetComponent
methods.description: Retrieves the component of the specified type, if it exists.

constructors.name: GameObject
constructors.description: Creates a new GameObject, with optional parameters to specify a name and set of components to attach.

description: Position, rotation and scale of an object.

properties.name: childCount
properties.description: The number of children the parent Transform has.

properties.name: eulerAngles
properties.description: The rotation as Euler angles in degrees.

properties.name: forward
properties.description: Returns a normalized vector representing the blue axis of the transform in world space.

properties.name: hasChanged
properties.description: Has the transform changed since the last time the flag was set to 'false'?

properties.name: hierarchyCapacity
properties.description: The transform capacity of the transform's hierarchy data structure.

properties.name: hierarchyCount
properties.description: The number of transforms in the transform's hierarchy data structure.

properties.name: localEulerAngles
properties.description: The rotation as Euler angles in degrees relative to the parent transform's rotation.

properties.name: localPosition
properties.description: Position of the transform relative to the parent transform.

properties.name: localRotation
properties.description: The rotation of the transform relative to the transform rotation of the parent.

properties.name: localScale
properties.description: The scale of the transform relative to the GameObjects parent.

properties.name: localToWorldMatrix
properties.description: Matrix that transforms a point from local space into world space (Read Only).

properties.name: lossyScale
properties.description: The global scale of the object (Read Only).

properties.name: parent
properties.description: The parent of the transform.

properties.name: position
properties.description: The world space position of the Transform.

properties.name: right
properties.description: The red axis of the transform in world space.

properties.name: root
properties.description: Returns the topmost transform in the hierarchy.

properties.name: rotation
properties.description: A Quaternion that stores the rotation of the Transform in world space.

properties.name: up
properties.description: The green axis of the transform in world space.

properties.name: worldToLocalMatrix
properties.description: Matrix that transforms a point from world space into local space (Read Only).

methods.name: DetachChildren
methods.description: Unparents all of the target object's children.

methods.name: Find
methods.description: Finds a child by name n and returns it.

methods.name: GetChild
methods.description: Returns a transform child by index.

methods.name: GetLocalPositionAndRotation
methods.description: Updates the value of the out parameters localPosition and localRotation with the transform's current position and rotation in local space (that is, relative to its parent's transform).

methods.name: GetPositionAndRotation
methods.description: Updates the value of the out parameters position and rotation with the transform's current position and rotation in world space (that is, relative to the scene's origin coordinates).

methods.name: GetSiblingIndex
methods.description: Gets the index of this Transform, relative to its siblings.

methods.name: InverseTransformDirection
methods.description: Transforms a direction from world space to local space. The opposite of Transform.TransformDirection.

methods.name: InverseTransformDirections
methods.description: Transforms multiple directions from world space to local space overwriting each original position with the transformed version. The opposite of Transform.TransformDirections.

methods.name: InverseTransformPoint
methods.description: Transforms position from world space to local space.

methods.name: InverseTransformPoints
methods.description: Transforms multiple positions from world space to local space overwriting each original position with the transformed version.

methods.name: InverseTransformVector
methods.description: Transforms a vector from world space to local space. The opposite of Transform.TransformVector.

methods.name: InverseTransformVectors
methods.description: Transforms multiple vectors from world space to local space overwriting each original position with the transformed version. The opposite of Transform.TransformVectors.

methods.name: IsChildOf
methods.description: Is this transform a child of parent?

methods.name: LookAt
methods.description: Rotates the transform so the forward vector points at /target/'s current position.

methods.name: Rotate
methods.description: Use Transform.Rotate to rotate GameObjects in a variety of ways. The rotation is often provided as an Euler angle and not a Quaternion.

methods.name: RotateAround
methods.description: Rotates the transform about axis passing through point in world coordinates by angle degrees.

methods.name: SetAsFirstSibling
methods.description: Move the transform to the start of the local transform list.

methods.name: SetAsLastSibling
methods.description: Move the transform to the end of the local transform list.

methods.name: SetLocalPositionAndRotation
methods.description: Sets the position and rotation of the Transform component in local space (i.e. relative to its parent transform).

methods.name: SetParent
methods.description: Set the parent of the transform.

methods.name: SetPositionAndRotation
methods.description: Sets the world space position and rotation of the Transform component.

methods.name: SetSiblingIndex
methods.description: Sets the sibling index.

methods.name: TransformDirection
methods.description: Transforms direction from local space to world space.

methods.name: TransformDirections
methods.description: Transforms multiple directions from local space to world space overwriting each original direction with the transformed version.

methods.name: TransformPoint
methods.description: Transforms position from local space to world space.

methods.name: TransformPoints
methods.description: Transforms multiple points from local space to world space overwriting each original point with the transformed version.

methods.name: TransformVector
methods.description: Transforms vector from local space to world space.

methods.name: TransformVectors
methods.description: Transforms multiple vectors from local space to world space overwriting each original vector with the transformed version.

methods.name: Translate
methods.description: Moves the transform along its x, y, and z axes by the values of the translation parameter's x, y, and z components respectively.

description: Base class for everything attached to a GameObject.

properties.name: gameObject
properties.description: The game object this component is attached to. A component is always attached to a game object.

properties.name: tag
properties.description: The tag of this game object.

properties.name: transform
properties.description: The Transform attached to this GameObject.

properties.name: transformHandle
properties.description: The TransformHandle of this GameObject.

methods.name: BroadcastMessage
methods.description: Calls the method named methodName on every MonoBehaviour in this game object or any of its children.

methods.name: CompareTag
methods.description: Checks the GameObject's tag against the defined tag.

methods.name: GetComponent
methods.description: Gets a reference to a component of type T on the same GameObject as the component specified.

methods.name: GetComponentInChildren
methods.description: Gets a reference to a component of type T on the same GameObject as the component specified, or any child of the GameObject.

methods.name: GetComponentIndex
methods.description: Gets the index of the component on its parent GameObject.

methods.name: GetComponentInParent
methods.description: Gets a reference to a component of type T on the same GameObject as the component specified, or any parent of the GameObject.

methods.name: GetComponents
methods.description: Gets references to all components of type T on the same GameObject as the component specified.

methods.name: GetComponentsInChildren
methods.description: Gets references to all components of type T on the same GameObject as the component specified, and any child of the GameObject.

methods.name: GetComponentsInParent
methods.description: Gets references to all components of type T on the same GameObject as the component specified, and any parent of the GameObject.

methods.name: SendMessage
methods.description: Calls the method named methodName on every MonoBehaviour in this game object.

methods.name: SendMessageUpwards
methods.description: Calls the method named methodName on every MonoBehaviour in this game object and on every ancestor of the behaviour.

methods.name: TryGetComponent
methods.description: Gets the component of the specified type, if it exists.

description: MonoBehaviour is a base class that many Unity scripts derive from.

properties.name: destroyCancellationToken
properties.description: Cancellation token raised when the MonoBehaviour is destroyed (Read Only).

properties.name: didAwake
properties.description: Returns a boolean value which represents if Awake was called.

properties.name: didStart
properties.description: Returns a boolean value which represents if Start was called.

properties.name: runInEditMode
properties.description: Allow a specific instance of a MonoBehaviour to run in edit mode (only available in the editor).

properties.name: useGUILayout
properties.description: Disabling this lets you skip the GUI layout phase.

methods.name: CancelInvoke
methods.description: Cancels all Invoke calls on this MonoBehaviour.

methods.name: Invoke
methods.description: Invokes the method methodName in time seconds.

methods.name: InvokeRepeating
methods.description: Invokes the specified method after a specified delay, then repeatedly at the specified rate.

methods.name: IsInvoking
methods.description: Is any invoke on methodName pending?

methods.name: StartCoroutine
methods.description: Starts a coroutine.

methods.name: StopAllCoroutines
methods.description: Stops all coroutines running on this MonoBehaviour.

methods.name: StopCoroutine
methods.description: Stops the first coroutine named methodName, or the coroutine stored in routine running on this behaviour.

description: A Camera is a device through which the player views the world.

properties.name: activeTexture
properties.description: Gets the temporary RenderTexture target for this Camera.

properties.name: actualRenderingPath
properties.description: The rendering path that is currently being used (Read Only).

properties.name: allowDynamicResolution
properties.description: Dynamic Resolution Scaling.

properties.name: allowHDR
properties.description: High dynamic range rendering.

properties.name: allowMSAA
properties.description: MSAA rendering.

properties.name: anamorphism
properties.description: The camera anamorphism. To use this property, enable UsePhysicalProperties.

properties.name: aperture
properties.description: The camera aperture. To use this property, enable UsePhysicalProperties.

properties.name: areVRStereoViewMatricesWithinSingleCullTolerance
properties.description: Determines whether the stereo view matrices are suitable to allow for a single pass cull.

properties.name: aspect
properties.description: The aspect ratio (width divided by height).

properties.name: backgroundColor
properties.description: The color with which the screen will be cleared.

properties.name: barrelClipping
properties.description: The camera barrel clipping. To use this property, enable UsePhysicalProperties.

properties.name: bladeCount
properties.description: The blade count in the lens of the camera. To use this property, enable UsePhysicalProperties.

properties.name: cameraToWorldMatrix
properties.description: Matrix that transforms from camera space to world space (Read Only).

properties.name: cameraType
properties.description: Identifies what kind of camera this is, using the CameraType enum.

properties.name: clearFlags
properties.description: How the camera clears the background.

properties.name: clearStencilAfterLightingPass
properties.description: Should the camera clear the stencil buffer after the deferred light pass?

properties.name: commandBufferCount
properties.description: Number of command buffers set up on this camera (Read Only).

properties.name: cullingMask
properties.description: This is used to render parts of the Scene selectively.

properties.name: cullingMatrix
properties.description: Sets a custom matrix for the camera to use for all culling queries.

properties.name: curvature
properties.description: The curvature of the blades. To use this property, enable UsePhysicalProperties.

properties.name: depth
properties.description: Camera's depth in the camera rendering order.

properties.name: depthTextureMode
properties.description: How and if camera generates a depth texture.

properties.name: eventMask
properties.description: Mask to select which layers can trigger events on the camera.

properties.name: farClipPlane
properties.description: The distance of the far clipping plane from the Camera, in world units.

properties.name: fieldOfView
properties.description: The vertical field of view of the Camera, in degrees.

properties.name: focalLength
properties.description: The camera focal length, expressed in millimeters. To use this property, enable UsePhysicalProperties.

properties.name: focusDistance
properties.description: The focus distance of the lens. To use this property, enable UsePhysicalProperties.

properties.name: forceIntoRenderTexture
properties.description: Should camera rendering be forced into a RenderTexture.

properties.name: gateFit
properties.description: There are two gates for a camera, the sensor gate and the resolution gate. The physical camera sensor gate is defined by the sensorSize property, the resolution gate is defined by the render target area.

properties.name: iso
properties.description: The sensor sensitivity of the camera. To use this property, enable UsePhysicalProperties.

properties.name: isProcessingRenderRequest
properties.description: Whether the camera is currently processing a render request.

properties.name: layerCullDistances
properties.description: Per-layer culling distances.

properties.name: layerCullSpherical
properties.description: How to perform per-layer culling for a Camera.

properties.name: lensShift
properties.description: The lens offset of the camera. The lens shift is relative to the sensor size. For example, a lens shift of 0.5 offsets the sensor by half its horizontal size.

properties.name: nearClipPlane
properties.description: The distance of the near clipping plane from the Camera, in world units.

properties.name: nonJitteredProjectionMatrix
properties.description: Get or set the raw projection matrix with no camera offset (no jittering).

properties.name: opaqueSortMode
properties.description: Opaque object sorting mode.

properties.name: orthographic
properties.description: Is the camera orthographic (true) or perspective (false)?

properties.name: orthographicSize
properties.description: Camera's half-size when in orthographic mode.

properties.name: overrideSceneCullingMask
properties.description: Sets the culling mask used to determine which objects from which Scenes to draw. See EditorSceneManager.SetSceneCullingMask.

properties.name: pixelHeight
properties.description: How tall is the camera in pixels (not accounting for dynamic resolution scaling) (Read Only).

properties.name: pixelRect
properties.description: Where on the screen is the camera rendered in pixel coordinates.

properties.name: pixelWidth
properties.description: How wide is the camera in pixels (not accounting for dynamic resolution scaling) (Read Only).

properties.name: previousViewProjectionMatrix
properties.description: Get the view projection matrix used on the last frame.

properties.name: projectionMatrix
properties.description: The 4x4 matrix that's used to transform world space coordinates to clip space coordinates.

properties.name: rect
properties.description: Where on the screen is the camera rendered in normalized coordinates.

properties.name: renderCloudsInSceneView
properties.description: Whether Unity renders clouds in the Scene view for this camera.

properties.name: renderingPath
properties.description: The rendering path that should be used, if possible.

properties.name: scaledPixelHeight
properties.description: How tall is the camera in pixels (accounting for dynamic resolution scaling) (Read Only).

properties.name: scaledPixelWidth
properties.description: How wide is the camera in pixels (accounting for dynamic resolution scaling) (Read Only).

properties.name: scene
properties.description: If not null, the camera will only render the contents of the specified Scene.

properties.name: sensorSize
properties.description: The size of the camera sensor, expressed in millimeters.

properties.name: shutterSpeed
properties.description: The exposure time of the camera, in seconts. To use this property, enable UsePhysicalProperties.

properties.name: stereoActiveEye
properties.description: Returns the eye that is currently rendering. If called when stereo is not enabled it will return Camera.MonoOrStereoscopicEye.Mono. If called during a camera rendering callback such as OnRenderImage it will return the currently rendering eye. If called outside of a rendering callback and stereo is enabled, it will return the default eye which is Camera.MonoOrStereoscopicEye.Left.

properties.name: stereoConvergence
properties.description: Distance to a point where virtual eyes converge.

properties.name: stereoEnabled
properties.description: Stereoscopic rendering.

properties.name: stereoSeparation
properties.description: The distance between the virtual eyes. Use this to query or set the current eye separation. Note that most VR devices provide this value, in which case setting the value will have no effect.

properties.name: stereoTargetEye
properties.description: Defines which eye of a VR display the Camera renders into.

properties.name: targetDisplay
properties.description: Set the target display for this Camera.

properties.name: targetTexture
properties.description: Destination render texture.

properties.name: transparencySortAxis
properties.description: An axis that describes the direction along which the distances of objects are measured for the purpose of sorting.

properties.name: transparencySortMode
properties.description: Transparent object sorting mode.

properties.name: useJitteredProjectionMatrixForTransparentRendering
properties.description: Should the jittered matrix be used for transparency rendering?

properties.name: useOcclusionCulling
properties.description: Whether or not the Camera will use occlusion culling during rendering.

properties.name: usePhysicalProperties
properties.description: Enable usePhysicalProperties to use physical camera properties to compute the field of view and the frustum.

properties.name: velocity
properties.description: Get the world-space speed of the camera (Read Only).

properties.name: worldToCameraMatrix
properties.description: Matrix that transforms from world to camera space.

methods.name: AddCommandBuffer
methods.description: Add a command buffer to be executed at a specified place.

methods.name: AddCommandBufferAsync
methods.description: Adds a command buffer to the GPU's async compute queues and executes that command buffer when graphics processing reaches a given point.

methods.name: CalculateFrustumCorners
methods.description: Given viewport coordinates, calculates the view space vectors pointing to the four frustum corners at the specified camera depth.

methods.name: CalculateObliqueMatrix
methods.description: Calculates and returns oblique near-plane projection matrix.

methods.name: CopyFrom
methods.description: Makes this camera's settings match other camera.

methods.name: CopyStereoDeviceProjectionMatrixToNonJittered
methods.description: Sets the non-jittered projection matrix, sourced from the VR SDK.

methods.name: GetCommandBuffers
methods.description: Get command buffers to be executed at a specified place. This API is only available with the Built-in renderer.

methods.name: GetGateFittedFieldOfView
methods.description: Retrieves the effective vertical field of view of the camera, including GateFit. Fitting the sensor gate and the resolution gate has an impact on the final field of view. If the sensor gate aspect ratio is the same as the resolution gate aspect ratio or if the camera is not in physical mode, then this method returns the same value as the fieldofview property.

methods.name: GetGateFittedLensShift
methods.description: Retrieves the effective lens offset of the camera, including GateFit. Fitting the sensor gate and the resolution gate has an impact on the final obliqueness of the projection. If the sensor gate aspect ratio is the same as the resolution gate aspect ratio, then this method returns the same value as the lenshift property. If the camera is not in physical mode, then this methods returns Vector2.zero.

methods.name: GetStereoNonJitteredProjectionMatrix
methods.description: Gets the non-jittered projection matrix of a specific left or right stereoscopic eye.

methods.name: GetStereoProjectionMatrix
methods.description: Gets the projection matrix of a specific left or right stereoscopic eye.

methods.name: GetStereoViewMatrix
methods.description: Gets the left or right view matrix of a specific stereoscopic eye.

methods.name: RemoveAllCommandBuffers
methods.description: Remove all command buffers set on this camera.

methods.name: RemoveCommandBuffer
methods.description: Remove command buffer from execution at a specified place.

methods.name: RemoveCommandBuffers
methods.description: Remove command buffers from execution at a specified place.

methods.name: Render
methods.description: Render the camera manually.

methods.name: RenderToCubemap
methods.description: Render into a static cubemap from this camera.

methods.name: RenderWithShader
methods.description: Render the camera with shader replacement.

methods.name: Reset
methods.description: Revert all camera parameters to default.

methods.name: ResetAspect
methods.description: Revert the aspect ratio to the screen's aspect ratio.

methods.name: ResetCullingMatrix
methods.description: Make culling queries reflect the camera's built in parameters.

methods.name: ResetProjectionMatrix
methods.description: Make the projection reflect normal camera's parameters.

methods.name: ResetReplacementShader
methods.description: Remove shader replacement from camera.

methods.name: ResetStereoProjectionMatrices
methods.description: Reset the camera to using the Unity computed projection matrices for all stereoscopic eyes.

methods.name: ResetStereoViewMatrices
methods.description: Reset the camera to using the Unity computed view matrices for all stereoscopic eyes.

methods.name: ResetTransparencySortSettings
methods.description: Resets this Camera's transparency sort settings to the default. Default transparency settings are taken from GraphicsSettings instead of directly from this Camera.

methods.name: ResetWorldToCameraMatrix
methods.description: Make the rendering position reflect the camera's position in the Scene.

methods.name: ScreenPointToRay
methods.description: Returns a ray going from camera through a screen point.

methods.name: ScreenToViewportPoint
methods.description: Transforms position from screen space into viewport space.

methods.name: ScreenToWorldPoint
methods.description: Transforms a point from screen space into world space, where world space is defined as the coordinate system at the very top of your game's hierarchy.

methods.name: SetReplacementShader
methods.description: Make the camera render with shader replacement.

methods.name: SetStereoProjectionMatrix
methods.description: Sets a custom projection matrix for a specific stereoscopic eye.

methods.name: SetStereoViewMatrix
methods.description: Sets a custom view matrix for a specific stereoscopic eye.

methods.name: SetTargetBuffers
methods.description: Sets the Camera to render to the chosen buffers of one or more RenderTextures.

methods.name: SubmitRenderRequest
methods.description: Submits a render request to the camera outside of Unity render loop.

methods.name: TryGetCullingParameters
methods.description: Get culling parameters for a camera.

methods.name: ViewportPointToRay
methods.description: Returns a ray going from camera through a viewport point.

methods.name: ViewportToScreenPoint
methods.description: Transforms position from viewport space into screen space.

methods.name: ViewportToWorldPoint
methods.description: Transforms position from viewport space into world space.

methods.name: WorldToScreenPoint
methods.description: Transforms position from world space into screen space.

methods.name: WorldToViewportPoint
methods.description: Transforms position from world space into viewport space.
